website_summaries.verdict: The tiny Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX50 is a lot of camera for the money, with solid shooting performance, and good photo and movie quality.
pros: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX50 offers excellent features for automatic snapshots and speedy shooting performance, and nice photo and video quality for its class
cons: The WX50's controls might be too small for some users and its photos aren't sharp enough for pixel peepers

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my dinky Canon
customer_reviews.text: I had a point and shoot Canon elf something or other, and this camera is MILES above it. It's quick, the battery life lasts forever, and for a point and shoot it has more options than I could imagine. It takes sharp pictures, and doesn't lag a lot between shots. The flash works well (well enough for a P&S), and the autofocus is fantastic. I could rave forever about the other features, but honestly, it's just a great little camera, that's mostly intuitive, with tons of features and takes great pictures. If you need something tiny and quick, this is a fantastic bet.
customer_reviews.author: emmy5881

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera works really well but you really need ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera works really well but you really need to order extra batteries if you plan on using it for school plays and longer outings as the battery does not last a long time when using the movie feature. Like that you can take video, zoom and take photos (I think 10 per recording time) all at the same time. Bought for my husband and he really likes it as well and he does have larger hands and can use it but wanted to let others know to be aware as camera is pocket sized.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie P

customer_reviews.title: NO BATTERY OR CORD, UNUSABLE.
customer_reviews.text: This used item was delivered from seller Ztron without a battery or charge cord, so I have no idea if it even works.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter, so please understand that when reading this very brief review. She has owned several cameras over the last several years: a Lumix and a Canon. She greatly prefers this little Sony to those cameras. In the first week she took over 400 pictures with it. She is a terrific photographer and works in the punk community. She has told me that the quality of the images has been consistently terrific and she has loved several of the camera's special effects options.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gross

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it....great video and pretty good shots, especially outside
customer_reviews.text: I brought this camera to Mexico for a trip to the Yucatan. It is SO tiny and portable. Got fantastic video clips of all the sights I wanted to see. Was particularly good for outside pictures. Inside, with low lighting, you really need to play with the settings to get shots that aren't grainy. For the price, this camera is fantastic for video and pictures (most especially ones outside in natural light). The portability if simply amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good battery life, customization themes
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great for what I need it for. I am very happy with the quality and the features. Shoots full 1080p video and 4k still photos. I use a micro sd card in it with the adapter and use my phone to import photos i want to share. Works great with Android phones with micro my 16gb sd card. I no longer need to get to a computer to share photos, but when i do works fine. Different themes to choose from and many features to get the right shot,
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: The best camera I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a tech savy camera buff. So if I can get it to work it must be easy. The pictures in all modes so far have come out great, Clear as a bell. It shoots the picture when you press the button not when it wants to. In movie mode you can shoot stills. By pressing the button. Colors seem lifelike. Battery life seems fine. Have not found any cons yet, except it's a little hard to see the screen in bright sunlight, But I just pointed and shot and the pics came out great. And sound is a little scratchy
customer_reviews.author: rt1092

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: NIce used camera. No problems and its small size is perfect for keeping in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good camera
customer_reviews.text: I went through Sony WX1 (lost) and WX5 (repair costs more than the price of WX50 due to my harsh abuse & lack of care) before finding WX50 which seems to beat other models on features and price. I like the WX series primarily for their low light picture taking ability, compact size and I almost never use zoom. Not sure how long this will last, but given the fate cameras suffered in my hands and the low cost of WX50, I'd say this fits perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures and love the size!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a digital camera before and was not happy with the quality of pictures, or the size. This one is the opposite! I love this camera! It is small and compact and takes delightful, clear, crisp pictures. I especially like the fact that there is not a sizable delay once focused and then taking the picture. So often pictures would be blurred with my other camera. This one is just great and would recommend to the novice photographer!
customer_reviews.author: Tall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about this camera (purchased in April 2012), but my wife and I just took it out of the box and are blown away by what this camera can do! I was VERY concerned about its video capabilities, because I'm a mac user. I had read some reviews that said it used an out-dated video codec, so I was surprised to find out that it also has an MP4 option in the menu! Go Sony!!!! Amazing pictures. Amazing video. Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Berggren

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was using this as a camcorder and it works well. It will record 720p video and 1080i video. The downside is that too many of the setting are not manual (if the company would unlock more of the features it would be 5 stars). The optics perform well and there is not too much distortion. Another downside it that the cmos sensor will sometimes do a rolling shutter on rapidly changing brightness. The pictures are clear and crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Broughton

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera!
customer_reviews.text: We were in need of a good point and shoot camera that delivered the same high quality photos as our DSLR but that could be taken to places that don't allow our "detachable lens camera". This fit the bill. This camera is light, slender and has a solid feel to the body. It takes great photos and offers numerous options that are user friendly. The price was fantastic and much less that in the retail stores. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: mistressofstinge

customer_reviews.title: Duplicating a good thing...
customer_reviews.text: The first camera model DSC-WX50 was puchased a few years ago and I have been daily amazed by its perforance. It has functioned perfectly since its purchase and the simple fact is, that although my original DSC-WX50 is working fine, I wanted a back-up to a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: The Watchman

customer_reviews.title: Great camera on the cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought the sony Cyber-shot to take with me while I'm living abroad, and so far it works great. Mind you, I'm not trying to take professional photos, just something to send back to my family and show them I'm alive and doing things. The only problem I have had with the camera is that sometimes pictures are constantly blurry, even with the shortest shutter setting and resting it on a solid surface. But, I think this may be more a problem with the settings I changed than with the actual camera because it doesn't happen all the time. If you want to use the other settings, maybe do what I didn't and read the manual!
customer_reviews.author: PabloFenixx

customer_reviews.title: Sony Cyber-shot
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little powerhouse of a camera!!! I have been looking for a camera that takes great pictures, small enough to pocket if need be and be able to learn how to use with the computer. This one fits just right in what I wanted in a camera. I can do more with the cyber-shot than I expected. Good little camera and for the price.... well that was even better ; ) Ginny K.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great when working
customer_reviews.text: The Good: The camera is very small and portable, easily fitting into a pocket or a small purse. Lots of great features and it is very easy to use. The photo quality was extremely good compared to my past cameras. The Bad: The camera worked flawlessly until the lens would no longer retract into the camera in less than a month's worth of use. Sent it off to be repaired (had to pay for shipping to service center). Was very excited for this camera until it stopped working. Hopefully it was just a problem with the camera I purchased and will have no further problems. Will update once I receive the camera back.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Wade Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Good until the mode selector dial becomes hyper-sensitive
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Sony Cyber-shot. Both were good cameras at first but both have suffered the same problem. After about 1.5 years (when they're no longer in warranty) the mode selector dial becomes hyper-sensitive so that it becomes difficult, if not impossible, to set the actual mode that you want... When you do happen to set the mode you want and lightly brush the dial while trying to take a picture it changes mode on you, more likely than not, messing up the photo. I can only assume that this is a common fault with Sony Cyber-shot cameras since it's happened to 2 out of 2 of mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice so far.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a vacation at the beach and took great pics, but not at first. Too Orange and surreal. Use the Easy mode. In this mode not great in low light but we did not do much at night anyway. Kids loved it. Takes great video too. Feels good in the hand. Decent build quality. No plastic. Only had it for two months will update later. Happy with purchase. Would buy again. Got the package deal with case and sim. Great deal for $100.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera, but...
customer_reviews.text: Had higher performance expectations. Glad my Coolpix 6000 still works. Battery life varies. Colors can be bright at times, but some stills have white-out. Video is great, but don't like file saving names. Video shots are NOT saved in sequential order with still shots. Play Memories software can be quirky at times. Will stay with Nikon Brand.
customer_reviews.author: Richard842

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for my husband who's an electrician. He wanted it to take pictures on job sites when the sheet rockers bury his wires. He finds it useful so he keeps it in his truck. Sorry I can't elaborate on it's specific qualities, but we've owned Sony Cyber-shots in the past and have no complaints. They're great reliable little point and shoot cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!

It is the best point and shoot camera I ever had : it is light, small and even though the lens is not fantastic, the digital signal processing it offers allows you to make picture no other camera can do (I have a Nikon D90 that cannot compare for night shot or high dynamic pictures). I love it !

customer_reviews.title: Great photos and very easy to use

Would easily recommend it to others, especially at the price at which we bought it, just a little over $110.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures, and fast!
customer_reviews.text: This Sony is a great camera for the price, pictures are very clear and the delay from when you push the button to it taking the picture is FAST! I bought this over the canon A2300 camera, which I bought for Christmas, and this is hands down way better. Night and day difference. The menu options are easy to use. This is a great buy for a point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: plumber

customer_reviews.title: Screen Went in 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Loved this camera, especially the soft skin feature. Then, without warning, the screen had a big grey square right in the middle. Took a picture, turned the camera off, and 5 minutes later went to take another picture, and the screen became defective... could only partially view the photos taken due to the grey square. I didnt drop it or agitate it in any way to cause the issue. Called Sony, and the camera was 10 DAYS outside the 1 year warrenty, and they refused to fix it unless I paid $90... the camera itself cost around $100. Poor quality, poor customer service, I will stick to Samsung products. Its a shame Sony does not stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C.

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy camera

All I wanted was a return and they wont even do that.....SAVE YOUR MONEY PEOPLE !!
customer_reviews.author: STEVE EASTMAN

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Sony digital camera that I ever bought. I was always been a Canon fan, but after breaking down my third Canon camera in a row, I do not want to buy Canon any more. I was always hesitant to buy Sony due to the memory card comparability. But this camera takes regular SD/SDHC cards, and I am glad that I bought it. I really like the powerful flash, faster shutter speed, great low light performance with in auto mode is a big plus. It is very compact, and yet has 5X zoom. I like the video smoothness as well. Can not expect anything more than these features for a point and shoot compact camera.
customer_reviews.author: Madhu

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: As a professional photographer, I am pretty picky when it comes to cameras. I bought this for an upcoming trip, as I don't want to haul my DSLR all over Prague. I've only played with this camera for a few hours, but the photographs look awesome! I'm usually not a fan of "in camera effects", but I am loving some of the extras that this camera comes with. The only downside is that you have very little control over the settings, but the camera is smarter than even most professionals the majority of the time anyway. If you are looking for a camera that takes great pics and fits in your pocket. This is the one!

customer_reviews.title: Great pics, but thank God for the tip I ...

customer_reviews.title: Good value

Pros: HD recording (awesome); Zoom while recording; Small size; Cons: If you zoom a picture after it was taken, it does looks blurry (like a painting); In my opinion, it's the best point and shoot type of camera.

I wanted to take photos I could frame and shoot videos I could watch over, not just retire them them to an online album I'd never see again. The photos are clear and sharp, the video is sooooo nice. I have no need to buy another camera.

customer_reviews.title: I am neutral due to out-of-box failure

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

The zoom is better than most. We are going to buy another like it, for his and hers cameras, since we often aren't in the same place at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera--beautiful, high quality pictures and really easy to use. Love the intelligent auto setting so that the camera adjusts settings based on what it recognizes in the frame (i.e. portrait, landscape, etc.). Fast shutter speed and great battery life.. The battery can be charged with a micro-USB which is easy as well. Also, the panoramic setting and 3-d filming is nice but not necessary. Great camera for a great price--the fact that is' the 2012 model doesn't make it a bad camera!

customer_reviews.title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX50
customer_reviews.text: I needed an affordable compact digital camera for the wife and I, and this camera is a great combination of ease of use for her and still has the serious control settings I like. I think the picture quality is very good for the price

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
